metadata.title: CVE-2020-35457 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: ** DISPUTED ** GNOME GLib before 2.65.3 has an integer overflow, that mightlead to an out-of-bounds write, in g_option_group_add_entries. NOTE: thevendor's position is "Realistically this is not a security issue. Thestandard pattern is for callers to provide a static list of option entriesin a fixed number of calls to g_option_group_add_entries()." The researcherstates that this pattern is undocumented.

criterions.comment: glib2.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
